DataElement.preferredName: Fluorescence in situ Hybridization Cytogenetic Abnormality Other Specify Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Free text to describe an irregularity in the number or structure of chromosomes that is different than the options specified using Fluorescence in situ Hybridization or FISH microscopy.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Fluorescence in situ Hybridization Cytogenetic Abnormality Other Present
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A type of IN SITU HYBRIDIZATION in which target sequences are stained with fluorescent dye so their location and size can be determined using fluorescence microscopy. This staining is sufficiently distinct that the hybridization signal can be seen both in metaphase spreads and in interphase nuclei._An irregularity in the number or structure of chromosomes, usually in the form of a gain (duplication), loss (deletion), exchange (translocation), or alteration in sequence (inversion) of genetic material._Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned._Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Fluorescence in situ Hybridization Cytogenetic Abnormality
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A type of IN SITU HYBRIDIZATION in which target sequences are stained with fluorescent dye so their location and size can be determined using fluorescence microscopy. This staining is sufficiently distinct that the hybridization signal can be seen both in metaphase spreads and in interphase nuclei.:An irregularity in the number or structure of chromosomes, usually in the form of a gain (duplication), loss (deletion), exchange (translocation), or alteration in sequence (inversion) of genetic material.

Concepts.definition: A physical mapping approach that uses fluorescent tags to detect hybridization of probes within metaphase chromosomes or less condensed somatic interphase chromatin. This technique can be used for identification of chromosomal abnormalities and for gene mapping.

An irregularity in the number or structure of chromosomes, usually in the form of a gain (duplication), loss (deletion), exchange (translocation), or alteration in sequence (inversion) of genetic material.

Property.preferredDefinition: Not otherwise specified.:Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The free text field that describes another response when other is chosen from a list of values.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Not otherwise specified.:Specify; be specific about something; define clearly.:Text; the words of something written.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
Be specific about something; define clearly.
